challenges.title: Exponents
description: Factors are numbers than are multiplied together, such as 5 \times 6\times 7 where 5, 6 and 7 are factors.
A factor repeated multiple times can be rewritten as a power with an exponent. The exponent is the small number that indicates how many times the base gets multiplied by itself.
In the above expression, the number 2 is the number being multiplied, so the base is 2. Since 2 is multiplied by itself 4 times, the exponent or power is 4.

challenges.title: Evaluate and Compare Powers
description: The bigger number, 8, is the base. This is the number that gets multiplied by itself when the expression is evaluated. The smaller number, 3, is the exponent. This is the number that indicates how many times the base gets multiplied by itself. Also known as a power.

challenges.title: Perfect Square Roots
description: Squares have four sides of the same length, meaning every side has the same length. Therefore, if you know the length of a side, you can calculate the area by squaring the length. This formula can be represented like this:
Conversely, if you know the area of a square, you can calculate the length of it's sides using the square root. Square roots are represented like this: s = \sqrt{A}
Perfect squares are numbers with square roots that are whole numbers. Some examples of perfect squares are 4, 9, 16, 25, 36, 49.
